Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide links to the reports or studies on which it is based.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the mild cases mentioned are directly related to the likelihood of survival, which may not be accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the percentage of mild cases, such as variations in testing and reporting methods across different regions.
Understate: The claim may understate the severity of the virus by focusing only on the percentage of mild cases and not considering the percentage of severe or critical cases.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the complete clinical picture of COVID-19 is not fully known and that the severity of the virus can vary based on age and baseline health.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by making a blanket statement about the virus without considering the complexities and uncertainties surrounding it.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the 80% figure by not providing a comprehensive analysis of the data and factors involved.
